FuncDef:
The transmission-alarm holdoff-timer command enables the alarm filtering function and set a filtering interval.
The undo transmission-alarm holdoff-timer command disables the alarm filtering function.
By default, this function is disabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the interval for filtering generated alarms.
The value is an integer ranging from 20 to 10000, in milliseconds. The default value is 50.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Frequent generation of alarms will cause the physical status of interfaces to switch between Up and Down. You can use the transmission-alarm holdoff-timer command to set an alarm filtering interval. In this manner, the alarms whose filtering intervals are larger than the alarm filtering interval will be ignored.
Prerequisites
Transmission alarm customization has been enabled on an interface.By default, LOF, and LOS alarms can cause the physical status of E1/E3 interfaces to go Down. LAIS, LOF, and LOS alarms can cause the physical status of CPOS interfaces to go Down.
Precautions
The value of the holdup-time parameter varies with the flapping frequency of interfaces.
